posts.name: marshall
posts.cooked:
That’s right… The moment you’ve all been waiting for has finally come.  I’ve ported Doom to the RoboRIO 2.0 ( https://imgur.com/a/hHcokz2 ):

https://i.imgur.com/nbK1P0z.mp4

link_counts.title: NI RoboRio 2.0 ... is it worth it?

posts.name: Andrew Schreiber
posts.cooked: Who hurt you?

posts.name: marshall
posts.cooked: IDKFA baby!

posts.name: Mike Taylor (he/him)
posts.cooked: man IDSPISPOPD would have been so useful in 2017

posts.name: Tyler Veness
posts.cooked: You should stick a Falcon 500 on there for sound.

posts.name: marshall
posts.cooked: EDIT: Kidding aside - it’s running chocolate-doom and it’s barely touching the CPU so it wouldn’t be all that difficult if someone wants to write the code for it using Phoenix and WPILib - just needs to use the SDL_mixer library and specify the falcon as the output device (I think?).  I’m kinda done at the moment.  I needed to recompile the kernel and verify I could get it working so adding a bunch of frame buffer stuff was a fun hack to that process but I got what I needed.

posts.name: bobbysq
posts.cooked: I wonder how easy it would be to interface a SC-88 to the RIO… Anyone have a MIDI output MXP board?

posts.name: DrWaSaBi - Russell R.
posts.cooked: Long over due.

posts.name: sanddrag
posts.cooked: Any reason it needs the RoboRIO 2.0 over the regular RoboRIO?

posts.name: marshall
posts.cooked: You could probably do it on a 1.0… but that is an exercise I will leave for someone else.

posts.name: Sam Geckler
posts.cooked: I spent entirely too much time in my graduate school lab playing a pre-WWW hard-wired computer to computer multiplayer version of Doom circa 1993. Would do it again!

posts.name: Stuart Rampy
posts.cooked: … But Can It Run Crysis?

posts.name: James
posts.cooked:
TSIMFD!

(More text cause I can’t just write that on CD)

posts.name: Kim
posts.cooked: I’m almost afraid to ask… Work like this is usually amidst actual research isn’t it?  What were you cooking  up or trying to…?
Very cool! Is that a Nextion display?

krf:

actual research

It’s DOOM. On a RIO. You need more than that?

posts.name: marshall
posts.cooked: Indeed.  I wanted to verify that the kernel build process works for the 2.0 as it did for the 1.0.  Turns out, there are a few differences that need to be worked out.  I’ve reported both of them to NI and waiting on their feedback and changes.

posts.name: marshall
posts.cooked: It’s an old robopeak usbdisplay via dfrobot.  They are hard to find these days but seeed has a version of the same driver that works with the wioterminal devices that they sell.

posts.name: Richard Wallace
posts.cooked: Marshall works in mysterious ways.

posts.name: Chris Gerth
posts.cooked: Add “Harbinger of DOOM” to the list .
